alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Alleghany and northern Surry Counties in northwestern North Carolina through 230 PM EDT... At 135 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mountain Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Dobson... Pilot Mountain... Mountain Park... Bottom... and Pine Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
